data.title: Good for breakfast and lunch
data.text:
In KC for a trade show at the convention center, staying at the Marriott.
Looked for a local place for breakfast , Silver Spoon was across the street. Nothing fancy, but great food and really friendly staff.
Returned for lunch the next day, even better. Sandwiches are far better and much less expensive than convention center fare.

data.title: Great Place for Breakfast
data.text: Across from Marriott.  Locals use and was a great place for a good reasonably priced breakfast.  Food was quick and good.

data.title: Great value, old-school moms/pops cafe :)
data.text: As soon as you enter, you fall back in time and get into this cafeteria style eatery from 70's. Here you find your typical home made types of sandwiches and sides, good old fat, grease and other yumminness (that tastes good but may not be that good for you)... the prices are awesome (always get a meal for $6- $10 for lunch)! They also call you by your name, and if you are a regular they would remember it!

data.title: Great lunch cafe
data.text: Went to this place for lunch and breakfast. Had one one of the best reuben sandwiches i've ever had and the croissant breakfast sandwich was pretty good as well. They were out of their specials both times i was there so they obviously must be good!

data.title: Find a better choice
data.text: If you're visiting KC, you can find better choices.  I had the rueben, not bad, not great.  Atmosphere is not good, the best is the price which are reasonable

data.title: Good value priced breakfast
data.text:
I grabbed breakfast while staying at the Ambassador. Prices were very reasonable and the standard breakfast diner fare was cooked to order. Pleasant enough service, very little by way of atmosphere, seemed like a place for office workers to get food to-go.

Lost a star due to the lack of Eco-friendly dishes/packaging. Even if they didn't want to wash dishes, a paper plate would have been preferable to a giant styrofoam clamshell box when eating in.

I would recommend for a budget-friendly basic meal.

data.title: Hello customer service!
data.text: Walked in as we are staying next door at the Ambassador (great place) at 10:35, only to be told breakfast stopped being served at 10:30, only one customer in the whole place, no one in line, and two guys servicing the counter doing nothing, no prepping, or anything, how hard is it to crack an egg or make a pancake? Not sure if this is Kansas city hospitality or if breakfast restaurants are hard to come by in this area, but if you treated customers like this in Chicago you would be out of business in a week! Strolled down to Cascones grill, service was quick, friendly, and food was good diner fare.

data.title: Great value, above average food
data.text: This place has inexpensive, above-average food. They feature fresh ingredients, and a local bakery supplies their bread. Their breakfasts and lunches are quite good.

data.title: Great food, went there entire stay
data.text: Breakfast food is really good, and not bad prices. Good location, and fairly fast for Made-to-order food! Seemed like a local favorite as well

data.title: Not fancy but great value.
data.text: If you're looking to save a little money and you want good eats.  Go to this little diner.  They only served breakfast and lunch.  Best value in Kansas City.

data.title: Fast, basic, cooked to order
data.text: Very basic counter service, plastic utensils, etc. Not much flavor, but inexpensive and quick.
